channel.title: Broken PSP
channel.description:
A few days ago I dropped my PSP and the umd slot case casing snapped off, and made the PSP unable to read anything I put in it. I know this falls under accidental damage and the warranty wont cover this, but I was wondering whether anyone has had any experience with Sony (SCEE or SCEA) with a broken PSP or any other product. Will this service cost me? What happens if they are unable to repair the damage?
TY

item.title: Broken PSP
item.dc:creator: @dbzmaster555 dbzmaster
item.description:
@dbzmaster555 wrote:

yeah it costs money like 70$ or so to replace the psp.

Read full topic

item.title: Broken PSP
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Change the firmware fo your PSP to a custom one, then download all the umd games you own and play them from your memory card. That’s what I did when my PSP couldn’t read umd’s anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Broken PSP
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I will e-mail them but unfortunatly I’m on holiday in Turkey for another week and a bit so I’ll ring them when I get back.

Read full topic

item.title: Broken PSP
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

My PS3 broke a while back but that was because it had overheated, it being in a stupid place. It was three months outside the warranty but they traded it in anyway and gave me a new one. Maybe it willbe different for accidental damage but just give 'em a ring and see what they say

Read full topic
